text: I ordered pizza for a gathering.  The wait was 40 minutes. At two hours they called and said 25 more minutes. 3 hours later it never showed. Screw these clowns.

I was looking forward to trying this place out after watching a video on social media on their chicken and waffle pizza. My boyfriend and I went here before the Backstreet Boys/Florida Georgia Line concert at Wrigley so we wanted to check out the pizza while we were in the area. We went here on a Friday afternoon and it was crowded. There's limited seating so keep an eye out for a seat or take it to-go. There's like window seating, one giant table in the middle where you sit with other people and like two booths. Luckily, my boyfriend snagged us a booth otherwise we would've been sitting on the floor. I ordered the Mac and Cheese and Chicken Parmesan Pizza (breaded chicken, penne, mozzarella, parmesan, asiago, and parsley). My boyfriend ordered the Breakfast of Champions (scrambled eggs, chorizo, green onions, and spicy mayo) and the Margherita. For $4.50 a slice, the pizza better be good. The Chicken Parmesan Pizza was the best one out of all the pizzas that we ordered but the overall the pizza just fell flat. Literally. The crust was so thin that the toppings fell off and it was messy. Overall, the pizza was average and way too overhyped. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here again when there's so many great pizza places in Chicago.

All they need to do here is use spatulas for the pizza and wear hair nets other than that's is a great atmosphere! The music is ok depending on what night it is. It tonight the cashier was awesome with her glasses and big hair. I also receive a free slice card Bc I got the wrong slice so I ended up satisfied. Other Thant that this spot has become my new place of fun.

After waiting in line for an hour for a mac n cheese pizza I was told they ran out of macaroni. I understand management isn't always able to predict events .. such as market days and a huge concert at Wrigley that have been scheduled for months. What I get upset about is I called 2 hours earlier to put in a to go order. When a mac n cheese pizza was taken out of the oven I was told it was a to go order. Weird I tried to do this two hours earlier?? As a former citizen of Chicago and someone who was in from California I am disgusted at whoever is managing this pizzeria now. In addition to all of this the employees try to pick a fight. Wow great customer service. I will no longer recommend this place to all my customers who frequent Chicago. Congratulations you just lost thousands and thousands of dollars.

Came here late night after visiting a few bars so eating greasy food was the objection.  There was three of us and we decided to get the large chicken n' waffles pizza. This pizza has fried chicken, melted butter, mozzarella, mini waffle bites, and a creme fraiche base topper with honey. So, while I would never order this pizza at 12:00pm or 7pm... at 2am it was rather delicious.  Overall this place fine for late nite food; however, it is crowded with drunk people (nothing wrong with that, just loud), and the place could be a bit cleaner.

Ok so i had the Mexican Corn pizza! It was awesome BUT the service was poor ! The lady who gets the pizza got mad at me for asking what kind of pizza was being served and then the cashier attitude was NASTY ! I asked her which was which and she rolled her eyes and ignored me ! I will not be going back due to the service and i really did like the food and i'm from out of town so first impression is everything. They also allowed a lady put her feet on the table with shoes on which is very unsanitary.
Visiting from the bay and I gotta say!...this is a hella of a good pizza! I loved the Buffalo pizza and especially the mac and cheese pizza, that pizza was lit!

This location is a bit rougher than the choice Wicker location, but Dimo's is always pretty decent across the board for a quick greasy slice type of pizza joint, and I've never had a huge problem here outside of the cramped location and often rowdy local clientele.
This place is terrible. They overcharged my credit card. It was only by $2 so I'm not going to contest it but just super lame...

I'm not sure if it's all the beer I've had before I go to this place but this pizza is seriously the bomb. The slices are pretty big so 2 pieces should do you well. What I love the most about Dimos is the insane pizza creations they come up with. The Mac N' Cheese pizza is probably my favorite but I've had pizza with BBQ chicken and bacon on it, French fries on another. I'm pretty sure I even had some form of a chicken and waffle pizza as well. I will say this place interior wise is nothing beautiful. But for the drunk, stoned and hungry patrons of Wrigleyville this place gets the job done and doesn't hurt your wallet.  Also don't forget your punch card! After so many visits/pizza slices you get a slice of pizza on the house! Which is of course awesome because who doesn't love free pizza?!?!?!

First stop when I got into Chicago Friday night . Got 2 slices of their Mac N cheese and margherita pizza . Place was  full but we luckily found a seat and got our slices quickly.  Good vibe ,nice people , and most of all good pizza and nice selection of beer. Definitely recommend stopping by especially if interested in Vegan and veggie pizzas.

One of the closest places to New York style pizza that I can find in the city filled with deep dish. I've been here for regular dinner and also late night drunken nights after the bars. All great experiences and delicious pizza! They have slices so you can just walk in and try it on your way to wrigley. Highly recommend!

Price is the best thing about this joint other than location.  2 very large slices of pepperoni pizza and a Mexican coke for around 10 bucks.  Food quality lacking.  Beyond greasy, won't be coming back.   To each their own.
Came here on a late night for Father's day. Service was great, mac and cheese pizza was very good. They're byob and it was great

So i placed an order tonight at 7 pm. for delivery of 1 pizza. i get an email at 726 saying it will be here by 805. I called the store at 836 and it was just leaving the store for delivery. Its now 901....no pizza. So over 2 hours for the delivery?? Inexcusable when they said it was going to be here an hour ago. I will never order delivery from here again.  To just call the store at 915 to ask why 45 minutes after I was told it was out for delivery....the guy at the store tells me the driver called when delivering and there was no answer. There was no phone call from the driver....and why wouldn't he walk up to my house like a normal delivery driver??! What kind of people deliver for them? If I could give 0 stars I would. The guy at the store told me I could go pick it up too. Gee great idea I should have done the tin the first place so I could have had dinner. NEVER ORDERING FROM HERE AGAIN.

A friend of a friend recommended this place and after a night of drinking and debauchery, we needed some fat and grease. It wasn't too shabby. It was crowded (a good indication, right?) and after about 20 minutes I was sitting down to a mac 'n cheese pizza. Pretty good for my first time trying something like that.  It's an unassuming place but I see why it's popular. I'd go back.
Their delivery isn't the fastest compared to other places near by but the pizza was good!

This place has good pizza, but is chronically lax about the accuracy of the product you'll receive. More often than not, the pizza received is either missing an ingredient, had an ingredient changed, or is just plain wrong. This happens way too often for me to fully recommend them.  Bottom line, you'll get a delicious product, but there's about a 50/50 chance that it won't be what you actually ordered.

Disclaimer: first time at dimos and first time there attempting to eat vegan, and long time Hungry Howie's cheesy bread fan. I recently watched What The Health, which has freaked me out into at least attempting to eat more plant based. Enter the first week of my attempt and I'm jonesing for some pizza. After some quick googling, I learn dimos, whose wrigleyville location is not more than 10 minutes walk from me, carries a vegan cheesy bread in addition to several vegan pizzas. I placed an online pickup order and their organized email updates made it easy to see when it was ready (it was ready earlier than they expected, which was also awesome). Picking up was easy- I ended up adding 2 slices to go for my boyfriend and the guy who helped me was very nice- he even suggested the (free) vegan ranch to compliment! But the real reason behind this 5 star rating is the sheer quality of the meal. And this is coming from someone who is a cheese lover- thank you dimos for making this attempt to be better to the earth and myself easier! While I understand this isn't health food, it's also nice not to feel like crap when you've gobbled down 4 pieces :) will definitely be back, vegan or not vegan!
Some fine NY style pizza. Came in here for a slice, and left with 3. Staff was friendly, wait time was good, and pizza was exceptional. Will come back again.

BEST PIZZA PLACE EVER! my boyfriend and I come here every time after a game! they always have a hookup! Also great late night grub. Open until 3 am. Their pizza is also very creative. I love the fact that I come back and there's something new all the time!

Environment: very crowded with intoxicated people always. not the cleanest spot either. Not much space to sit. Line goes quick though. Food: the BEST of late night pizza. Huge slices bigger than my face, and all with the greatest ingredients.  Mac and cheese pizza: Carbs * 1000? Sign me up. Twas delicious. Try it- you know you want to. Buffalo chicken pizza: Tastes just like it sounds and nothing bad about it. The buffalo sauce adds a nice kick to the hearty pizza. Honestly makes a good combo with the mac and cheese pizza (see above). Mouth is watering from thinking about how great this pizza was. Stomach is hurting though thinking of how much pain I was in the next morning...worth it!

Whether it's a victory slice after a cubs W or a depression slice after an L, Dimos is my favorite slice after a trip to Wrigley Field. Fairly inexpensive but great quality. My favorites include their mac and cheese pizza, buffalo chicken pizza, and chicken and waffles pizza. Next time you're in Wrigleyville make sure you complete the trip with a stop at Dino's!

Stopped in and got a pepperoni slice. It was much better than my previous visit. I highly recommend going with the classics if they are fresh. Otherwise, order one of the crazy recipes without thinking of it as "pizza".
Loved the idea of unique pizzas. Did not expect them to be charred. Would love the place if the pizza wasn't so overcooked.

Vegan pizza buyers beware: this is Daiya cheese central. If you don't like that gross creamy veggie-based cheese then you will NOT handle well with their unique offerings like "ranch" and "mac n cheeze". Next time I would compromise my values and dietary restrictions to never experience that amount of awful fake cheese again.  For vegan pizza trying to emulate real pizza, go crust and veggies...or buy Soya Kaas cheese and make your own at home!

This place is literally the best by the slice place I have ever been!! Teddy and Jason are the most amazing people I have ever dealt with in the restaurant industry. I feel privileged to be served by these amazing humans, took care of all my pizza needs!!!!

I ordered a pizza at 6:31pm. The expectation was set that the pizza would be delivered within an hour and fifteen minutes. It is currently 9:05pm, and the gentleman answering the phone at Dimo's stated the restaurant is "busy." Okay, that's fine. But you set the expectation that would deliver on your promise, and I am still sitting here with company at my apartment hungry as ever. This is completely unacceptable, and I will ensure to share this horrific experience with every individual I know. Do better Dimo's.

Great cheap food. I ordered three 20" pizzas and they were ready in 40 min. The employees were very nice and even gave me a handful of paper plates to take back with me when I kindly asked for some. The pizzas are a good deal - the 20" can feed about 4 pretty hungry people. My favorite pizza was the make-your-own with mushrooms and roasted red peppers. Can't really disappoint a large hungry crowd with this.
Nice spot if you're looking for a quick slice. Big fan of the BBQ chicken pizza. Would love to see some more selection and specials.
The chicken and waffles pizza was amazing. It's a small place with a few booths. Perfect for a quick bite before or after the game. By the slice, quick and cheap!
Meh. Ok at best. Sauce too sweet as is typical in Chicagoland. Crust a bit too soft and too thick

It's not Chicago deep dish, but the pizza here is damn good. Dimo's is one of my favorites for the variety of fun and obscure flavor combos. The buffalo chicken is my go-to, but everything I've had here from mac and cheese to chicken and waffles hits the spot. They always have specials and even have vegan options which is great.  The price is right at just $4.50 for a large slice, and the staff here is always really cool and friendly. The environment is young and hip and the staff is too! They're always friendly and smiling when taking your order, and last time around when the restaurant was a bit slow, we saw staff dancing around behind the counter while making the pizzas! Highly recommend.

Following an amazing night at the Full Shilling down the street, me and my friends wanted late night drunk pizza.  We googled the closest pizza place and Dimo's PIzza was it.  We walked in and there was no line. We ordered several slices of different toppings, including pepperoni, macaroni and cheese, buffalo chicken, and regular cheese.  It was absolutely DELICIOUS and CHEAP. It was such a perfect late night snack that we wished we went back for lunch the next day for something different.  Highly recommended for visitors and locals.
Hands down the best vegan pizza I've ever had. Dimos never disappoints! Service is always on point as well.

Stopped in for a slice after the Cubs game. La-Za-gna pizza of the day was delicious. Quick service, huge slice ($4-something). Would have been 4 stars, but staff earned the extra one for dealing with a particular episode of childishness I witnessed: Cashier: (addressing drunk Milennial white bruh with his head down on the counter) Are you ok, sir? Bruh: (looks up)....Is my pizza ready? Cashier: Just a moment. That will be $4.50.  Bruh: 450 what? Cashier: 4 dollars and 50 cents.  Bruh: .... Cashier: ..... $4.50. You have to pay for your pizza.  Bruh: I don't have to do anything.  Cashier: You have to pay for your pizza or get out of my line.  Bruh: ..... (Cashier ignores bruh and turns and helps the next couple in line.) Bruh: OH YEAH HELP HER BECAUSE SHE'S MORE IMPORTANT! I kid you not. Straight white men in your 20's, stop being like this, entitlement is not a good look bro. Every table around me asked wtf that guy's problem was as he finally realized he wasn't going to get any attention or pizza and slinked out of the restaurant to a chorus of "BYE DOUCHEBAG" from other patrons. So, if you like your pizza hot with a side of no-f***s given, Dimo's is the spot.

A little bit of a dive but if you're in a bind for pizza at any waking hour of the day (and let's be real... who isn't?), look no further than Dimo's. The macaroni and cheese pizza will change your life. Yes, they made macaroni and cheese a pizza topping, and I am all about it. They have other great flavor options, but I am loyal to the M & C! This place is perfect after a night of Clark Street fun.

In town visiting for the weekend and wanted a great late night snack!! We certainly got it! This pizza was unique, delicious, and very affordable! We'll definitely be back again when we come to town! Try their version of the Hawaiian pizza and BBQ chicken cheddar ranch pizza!

This place is ONLY good if you are drunk and there's no other option. It's dirty (the public bathroom is connected to the kitchen so ANYONE can go back there.) The employees are friendly but the boss seems very rude. I took my time eating my pizza one day and I just got weird stares from a man (who I presumed to be the boss) sitting on his computer across the room. The place was empty and it wasn't even close to closing. Nonetheless I felt uncomfortable like I was not wanted. I won't be back anytime soon- you couldn't PAY me to eat at Dimo's.

On an everlasting search for a "New York slice" in Chicago, this NY-er (born and raised) continues the search. Dimos gets close to that taste of home - the za is definitely displayed on the counter (at least it's not cooked to order deep dish). Friendly staff and quick service makes this a go-to while I continue my quest.

Just ate there tonight for the first time and it was amazing!! There was a long line but it went by quickly, very efficient. I had the chicken and waffles pizza and I could eat that every single day for the rest of my life SO GOOD

I mean, it's Dimo's. They specialize in weird pizza for a good price. They have vegan options. That automatically gives them an extra star! The Mac n' cheese pizza is way better than it sounds. Get it. You won't regret the cheesy goodness.  It's dive-y and a good place to go when you're drunk. Ask them to heat your pizza until it's well done, or it'll be hard to eat. It isn't the cleanest, but that isn't expected. My best advice? Go in with no expectations and an open mind. It'll be a drunken-evening go-to!

NOT IMPRESSED. After a long night of partying, I stopped into Dimo's looking for some after-hours pizza and ordered a pepperoni pizza and some other flavor, I forgot.  This pizza is an abomination and a poor representation of Chicago pizza.  The crust was burnt, the pizza had little cheese, little sauce and little flavor.  I just wanted some delicious after hours pizza! So disappointed, I feel like their late night crew doesn't give a shit and that's not okay.

Dimo's Pizza is thin sliced, not your regular deep dished Chicago pizza, but nevertheless it was delicious. Great for a quick bite while bar hopping in the area, especially since a lot of places close their kitchens early or at least that's how it felt since I'm from Miami.

Dimo's is that divey pizza joint that you go to after a few drinks, but it's also worth checking out when sober! They serve thin crust pizza by the slice, but you can also order a whole pie. Pizza is close to NY style, but Dimo's is in the oven longer giving their pizza more of a crunch and toasty flavor. The folks here are super nice and patient. I had a hard time figuring out what kind of pizza I wanted, and they said that they could make me something off the menu. How cool is that? How accommodating! I ordered a half pepperoni and sausage pie, and it came out in 15-20 minutes. Dimo's is located very conveniently close to Wrigley Field, and has street parking. It's a small joint, but the decor is pretty funny and somewhat grungy hipster. It's definitely worth giving Dimo's a shot. I love the variety they offer on their menu. There's always something new to try!
Love this place. The best pizza in lake view! So many different flavors! Definitely recommend for late hour pizza cravings!
Pizzas are really tasty but hygiene is not good: they take slices of pizzas with hands before to heat in the oven, no gloves, dirty clothes... I won't come back because of the lack hygiene.

Good pizza! Hipster twist on NYC slices. Friendly and very clean place to hang out and order pizza dining in or taking out. I think we paid $9.50 for a 12 inch pizza with half cheese and half pepperoni not a bad deal. I would like to go back and try their other pizzas in the near future.

I have never been to this location, to eat in.  Everything I have had from here has been ordered out. I do love Dimo's.  Let's face it, Chicago is a great pizza town.  Probably the best in the country.  Suck it, New York.  Chicago has it all - deep dish (of course), thin crust, classic toppings, weird shit, gourmet, and everything in between.  Sure, I've had better thin crust in Santa Cruz, CA and my favorite deep dish is in Tucson, AZ.  But overall, Chicago is the pizza capital of the universe, and I'll fight anyone who says differently! So that brings us to Dimo's.  Do you like Hawaiian?  You will die for theirs - pulled pork and fresh pineapple.  Amazing.  But they really shine with some of the more unique gourmet pizzas.  Seafood, duck, mac 'n cheese and a bunch of others.  Dino's has some great stuff. Order early, as they run out of some stuff.  And that should tell you something.  Their pizzas are great and a lot of people order them.  They do deliver to a wide area of Lakeview and Wrigleyville.  And if they are longer than expected in delivering, they will give you a coupon for a free slice.  Not the 'screw you' attitude of some places. Dino's has both deep dish and thin crust pizzas, classic and new.  The crust is delicious, chewy and well cooked.  The toppings are fresh and carried, and in a good quantity.  I'd like more cheese and more sauce on the pizzas, but both are well flavored.  In a city that has amazing pizzas, you could do a lot worse than Dimo's.

Big joint with seating in the front/ kitchen in the back with ovens & huge pizza's behind the glasss...hipsters everywhere!  They usually have like 7 different pies available for slices, some of the basics and some of the specialty za's.  Extensive menu with all kinds of different specialty pizzas or you can create your own.. they're known for their Mac & Cheese Pizza!  I went with the BBQ Chicken 'Za and it was outstanding.. you can tell they are using high quality ingredients & homemade sauces, etc.  Prices are a bit above average but the slices are HUGE and like I said earlier.. high Q ingredients!  Definitely a great spot for a quick bite in Bucktown/ Wicker Park area.... get dat did

This place used to be under another name when I ate here years ago. I am happy that it's still around. I moved out of state a couple years ago and have been craving their pizza for a long time. I finally went back during the World Series games and was hanging out in Wrigleyville. I convinced a couple friends that they HAD to have their pizza.  I thought one slice would make me full but I definitely needed two. I had the mac and cheese pizza. I was sad that they didn't have the smores pizza at the time. Remember before coming here that it's a small place and it might be hard to find a table or seat. If their is line...the wait is worth it! Oh and also they have honey on the side to eat with the crust which sounds weird but tastes good.

5 stars for the pizza, 4 stars for long delivery. I don't live too far and it took over an hour to be delivered. I called and the guy told me they had one delivery guy on a bike. Once it finally arrived the pizza was delicious and not cold.... next time I'd probably just go pick it up. Love their vegan options !

Cozy place. Quick service. Amazing selection and the variety on their specials change every month. Thin crust is their specialty and they are one of the best in Chicago. THE best in the Wrigleyville/Lakeview neighborhood.  I try to avoid them when the bars are getting out but if I'm in one of those bars and need pizza they are open super late to feed the belly monsters out there.

I'm obsessed! But wish they opened earlier than 4pm during the week. I'm hoping with the reviews and the love me and my friends have that eventually they will see the demand and open earlier! Please. :)

horrible delivery!  took over 2 hours to deliver.  when i called at an hour and a half, they said "it was on its way, sorry for the delay"... 10 minutes later i got the update that it was out for delivery.  they lie, and take an obscene amount of time to deliver!  dont order delivery from dimo's!!!
Pizza and salads were delicious! We had the hawaiian pizza with pulled pork and ate way more than we should have! It was really great that they were open late night as well!

Well pizza was ok Establishment was kinda rustic But in a pleasant comfortable manner Multiple pizzas ready made and huge variety But they did not score high for me: 1 bathrooms out of service - not cool 2 no ice for sodas or water - I like ice Pizza was good but not the best This is just my thoughts Based on my experience  Would I revisit ? Probably not.

I love this place. This is my go to place if I want yummy giant slices of pizza late at night! My friend and I were visiting from Indiana and we needed food at 2 am. Google said that it closed at 2:30. We made it there with fifteen minutes to spare. However, Google was wrong and they actually closed at 2. The employees were so nice that they actually let us come in get pizza even though they were closed. It was super sweet of them especially since I know how it is when people come in late at your place of work. They were great and the pizza was too! I will definitely be back as always!

Great pizza and a great price. Only problem is that unless it is a busy night they have a limited number of slice options. The good news is that if you are willing to wait they will make the pizza for you to take a slice of.

Have gotten the cheese bread there and it was amazing but the past two times the bread has been completely burnt!! SO disappointed! I even told the worker to make sure it wasn't burnt and it still was!

Amazing vegan options by the slice or the pie. Toppings from basic to crazy. Good looking salads, too. The only bummer is (as expected at a place offering so many slices) you can tell when a slice has been sitting out for a few hours. They warm your slices up but they can be s but dried out in the crust.

I guess everything tastes good when you are young and drunk. Pro: all individual pre made  slices are $4 each regardless of toppings included Cons: it's really expensive if you think about how much ny style pizza slices cost. Did I mention it tastes like crap. Maybe because I was sober. Very small and rowdy filled with drunktards. Dirty.
One Bite Pizza Review: Very floppy. It's drunk pizza. The whole vibe reminded me of Antonio's in UMASS which I think is very overrated. It's like a 6.2 out of 10 at best.  Was not deep dish at all.
Great place for getting pizza by the slice.  The mac n cheese pizza is probably their best one.  The penne and chicken one is somewhat decent, but needs a bit more sauce.

The best staff, the best pizza. I LOVE bringing people here cus the drunk pizza truly can't be beat. The staff is so so awesome and nice for having to deal with drunk people. They are so sweet and the pizza they sell-amazing. Tried the smores and the macaroni pizza (yes I was drunk) off of their recommendation-amazing. Come here for your pizza crazing you won't be disappointed

First off might I say that we stumbled upon this place and am I ever glad we came in. I'm not from Chicago (live in Canada) and I loved the place. Pizza was too notch, music was awesome and the guy who helped us behind the counter was willing to take the time to explain pizzas to us. If we ever visit Chicago again we will return
Late night, pizza by the slice...this is the spot.  I love this place.  They do a lot of interesting pizza's.  Try the mac n cheese and then move on.  The classic pepperoni is sooooo good.
Great pizza! Perfect crispy crust all the way through.  No beer but pizza makes up for it.  Also, they don't recycle but that's a quick fix.

Nice little pizza joint with some unique toppings. Loved the BBQChickenBaconCheddarRanch pizza and the Chik n Waffles was good. I wouldn't say that it was so good that I would seek out this place again. However, if you are in the area after partying it would be a great selection to make.
Delish!!  Super fast, super friendly, super yummy!  I will definitely add to the list for next time we're in town.
My pizza was burnt and my chair fell apart. Could you tell me my experience? I was coming here for a while and this probably completely will never be an option again.

I'm from New Jersey and ever since I moved to Chicago I've been looking for "east coast pizza" This is the closet I've come to finding it and it delicious. If you want amazing pizza you have found it. Amazing!!!

Ordered from this place tonight at 730, food came at 930. Cold and mediocre are the first things that come to mind.  I could have gone to the store, bought the ingredients and made a pizza, maybe better, myself in less time....

To be honest, I had way better pizza. But the customer service and the deliver boy boosted it to 5 stars. The person that took my order had a lot of patience with me and the delivery was lightening quick.

-huge slices of pizza that get popped back in the oven when you order it so it's nice and hot  -interesting toppings combinations (but they work) - - share with others so you can try a few different ones  -most importantly is the crust is crispy and thin (but not too thin) Definitely wanted a second slice!

So good I'm reviewing it while i'm sitting here. Not only do they have vegan options, they have _several_ vegan options. And not only do they have awesome vegan buffalo fake-chicken pizza, they have vegan ranch to dunk it in too. They also always have a really great super-local beer list. Staff is always extremely nice too. Eat here!
2 days later, no contact from Dimo's management. Wish that I could downgrade to 0 stars.
I tried their Mac and cheese pizza and the barbecue chicken pizza which were both okay. I found the crust to be a bit too dry and crispy for my preference.

Their pizza selection is incredible, including VEGAN options! The crust is delicious and the pies are reasonably priced. Plus, they carried vegan and non-vegan brownies and cookies, as well as artisan sodas and waters (but they have free water as well). It's a funky local place that is great for vegans and non-vegans alike!
This pizza tasted a lot better than I thought it would. I got a slice of spicy sausage and it was seriously delicious. Ambiance is typical Wrigleyville. That's all you need to know.

If you're looking for a New York Style pizza while you're in Chicago, you need to stop by here. Dimo's is a mom and pop shop that's been established for years and I really enjoyed eating here. I'll be upfront. I wasn't impressed with any of the Deep Dish Pizza while I was in Chicago. After trying a few spots, I missed NYC pizza so I found this spot via Yelp and it didn't disappoint me!

Came here after a Cubs game. The place reminds me of Antonios in Champaign. They got so many different types of pizza, its amazing. Saw the breakfast Pizza on Chicago's Best and had to try it, also got a buffalo chicken pizza as well. Both were good, but I was pretty drunk as well so I think that played quite a role in my opinion. This is not the best pizza you will eat, but for the huge amount of options its worth a try.

Forget deep dish-this pizza is amazing! And only a $4 delivery charge if you want to order in! The Mac and cheese pizza is the only thing you need in your life! Although I'm looking forward to trying their other creations in the future!
I wasn't thrilled.  I tend to compare to my neighborhood pizzeria.  I think the sauce was too sweet and it didn't taste that great.
Dimo's was amazing. Had the Buffalo pizza slice and the Chicken and Waffles slice. Delicious no matter the time and they are open late so that's a bonus!

One of the first things I look at when being served food is do the servers wash their hands or wear gloves? In this case the answer was no gloves. Just touching multiple people's food and tending money. Not my cup of tea. I went with 3 friends we all said it was fair? Would we come back? Probably not because there are multiple other pizza places to try in this area. The pizza sits out and when you order it they reheat it in the oven.

Dimo's= creative pizza. Got the mac and cheese pizza and the buffalo chicken and blue cheese slice. Was thinking I would save a piece for later but they were so good I finished it all in one sitting. Fairly cheap price for awesome flavor. This made up for a rather terrible pizza experience I had visiting Chicago earlier in the weekend. Will be coming back for more any time I come to the Chi!

If you like new york style pizza, chances are you'll like this place too. It's not 100% nyc style but i like the thinness of the crust and the variety of toppings they have. The interior is kind hipsterish.  Kind wish i had chosen a different pizza topping but would come back if i was in the neighborhood Order:  Hamburger pizza(?)

I've been here many times and absolutely love the pizza!! My go-to slice is the CPA (chicken parmesan alfredo) and my husband loves the chicken bacon cheddar BBQ ranch. Funny story but when we were finding out the gender of our baby, we gave the person the envelope with the ultrasound and said if it's a girl, give us the CPA (since that's my favorite) and if it's a boy give us the chicken BBQ ranch (since it is his favorite). They did this for us happily. In the box once we got home we celebrated over chicken BBQ ranch- it was a boy! Now he's 4 months old and soon enough I'll walk him over for some bites of pizza.  I also recently ordered delivery and it was outstanding service. The ETA was 545 pm. Well it arrived at 515 and it was perfectly HOT!! Excellent pizza flavors and these employees work hard. Tip them! Well deserved!!

Are you in the city right now? Will you become hungry in the next hour? And you've never tried Dimo's? "Yes", "yes", and "yes"? Then you should stop reading immediately and order yourself a 12".  But while you are waiting, perhaps you would like to read this pizza epic that I have written while procrastinating studying for the MCAT: I moved to Chicago 4 years ago.  Like many, I assumed the stuffed and deep dish pizzas were what every pie fiend like myself flocked to this city for.  I spent the first three years trying to figure out why.  Out of town guest after guest had me shipping out to Gino's, to Malnati's, to Giordano's, etc. to sample what they'd been instructed was the "true" Chicago pie, only to find ourselves slinking into our chairs into a cheesy coma that lingered throughout the afternoon. Oh, life before Dimo's. When my husband and I moved to the North Side earlier this year after so many years in Hyde Park, we ended up spending an evening over at Guthrie's Tavern in Wrigleyville.  Not long into our beers and boardgame, we found ourselves digging through Guthrie's menu can and out popped a name we'd never heard of: Dimo's.  A quick check on Yelp! and it seemed too good to be true.  "We must try this Mac & Cheese pizza," we said, and we did. And it was amazing.  Ooey, gooey, and filled to the brim with various cheeses and noodles to boot.  I learned my First Lesson of Dimo's then which was: One Does Not Skimp on Toppings.  I also learned the Second Lesson which is: One Always Pairs with Good Craft Beer. (Pssst, seriously though, get yourself a Hop Slam and settle in.). One thing people frequently remark about Dimo's is that the wait time is _real_.  To be fair, every delivery person I've seen has been on bike.  If you're ordering delivery, don't expect it to be there before the hour is up.  Most of the time it slides into home juuuuust about exactly around the time they say it will.  Once, though, it took nearly 2 hours, and our 12" arrived cool to the touch.  Disappointed, I called Dimo's and an employee was quick to apologize, acknowledge their mistake, and said they would add a note to our account that our next pizza would be on them.  The next week, we ordered again, and our complimentary 20"-incher arrived in no less than it could possibly take to make a pizza and deliver it over a mile away.  (This is a city in which your pizza establishment can literally see you from their shop window and won't make it to you in less than 45 minutes.)  The delivery person said, as he handed over the pie, "I believe this is all taken care of" and was surprised when we insisted on a tip.  The fact that we spoke up and were heard made a real impression.  This is the stuff of 5-stars. The Third (and, for now, Last) Lesson of Dimo's: One Makes Up for One's Mistakes. The only thing left to do in this review is to mention all the pizzas we've tried, since when I order Dimo's, the only question is: which one? We tried a slice of the S'mores pizza as an add-on dessert the first time around, you know, with The Mac. And it was good! But I've never been tempted to order it again, despite my weird childish love of s'mores. I say get it once then see if you want it again.  I will say one thing: it is decadent. I've only tried one of their monthly pizzas, and that was just last night.  The 2016 April pizza: the Desi Arnaz.  Yep, a cuban sandwich pizza. If you love cubans, you will love this pizza. White base, cheese upon cheese, generous chunks of lechon asado, ham, pickles, and mustard.  I feel like if I had to levy one critique that I would say that there was too much mustard. So if you're reading this and it's April, and you like cubans, consider ordering the Desi...maybe ask them to go light on the mustard.  For me, the Desi takes 4th place at Dimo's yet still is better than any other pizza in Chicago. So far, it's my husband's favorite.  So there's that.   Third Place so far goes to that glorious "The Mac". No other words.  This was the gateway drug.  Go, go now, go order yourself a Mac, even if you are vegan, because they've got a special one for you, too.   Second Place: Chicken n' Waffles. I love fried chicken. I love waffles.  I love chicken & waffles. I love pizza.  If this sounds like you, let's get you a CNW stat. Now, it is sweet, so if you're going to order a pizza and be disappointed that it isn't savory, save this for another time. Maybe brunch? First Place will always and forever, I think, go to: The Buff Chick.  The most visually impressive so far and stunningly explosive taste-wise, this takes the Dimo's cake.  That is to say: this is the best pizza I have ever tasted.  You know how I said somewhere above how impressively generous they were with mac and cheese?  I can't even tell you how many chunks of fried chicken there were on this monster (aside: monster is an appropriate characterization of a 20" pizza). I subbed more ranch for the blue. To quote Coldplay, "I saw sparks."

I love Dimo's. I've moved away and when I finally came back to Chicago I was determined to order Dimo's. I placed a pickup order, when I get there they had sold my pizza, so I had to wait for another one to be made. They refused or comp anything, or to give me any drinks unless I got back into a huge line. When I got home I realized they shorted me two slices of pizza. Service was horrible, the pizza was cold. This isn't the Dimo's I used to know.
Their pizza is on point!!! Came in and ordered their Mac pizza, delish!!! Highly recommend!

The food was pretty good but I can't describe how bad the delivery service was on this one. The pizza came over an hour late and without so much as a sorry from the delivery man. A truly horrible delivery experience.
Really nice place, very friendly personal!  Good pizza for very good price !   First time trying S'mores Pizza and was delicious  I recommend !  Definitely will come back !

We got bbq chicken, Mac and cheese, chicken and waffle, and spicy sausage(forgot the name). Each slice is $4!!  The bbq chicken is very good and I would definitely go back for it! The chicken and waffle is delicious and tastes very sweet!! It's addicting! These two are my favorite!  The Mac and cheese is disgusting, it's not very cheesy and it just tasted really weird and like old expired noodles. Stay away from this pizza! It's one of those weird things you just want to try but you regret after.  There were some aspects that I did not like about their pizzas. The slices are extremely thin and the meat were only placed in the center. So by the time you get to the crust there's no more meat!  I would come back again in the future but probably not for a long time.
So so bad. We just got our pizza (fast delivery, that's good), and everything but the crust is moosh. It's over salted. Really really bad. Maybe decent for drunk eating pizza.

I'm craving Dimo's so badly right now. I've been coming here since it was Ian's Pizza (around 7 years ago). I usually swing by for drunchies, but I had some leftovers the next morning and the pizza still tasted delicious. The mac & cheese pizza is amazing. I also tried the chicken and waffles, which has a bit of a sweet syrup-y taste. It was so good. My one quirk about this place is that there's always something weird happening inside, like a fight or argument of some kind. Let me eat my Dimo's in peace!

Had it brought in for a work lunch. Tried the margherita, one that had sausage and pepperoni on it and the mac and cheese...the mac and cheese was the only one that was decent and that's not even saying much. Whatever spices they used on their pizza was way too much...too salty as well. Ugh...I will never recommend.
Pretty good pizza for the price. Only $4 a slice, I liked the Mac n cheese pizza the best!

Barely three stars.  They need to work on their cleanliness, both behind the counter and in the rest of the restaurant.  The same person who handled pizza slices from the pizza trays to the oven bare-handed also rang us up, touching credit cards, cash and the register.  There isn't any ambience to this place either--no TV, the tables were dirty and the front door was wide open on a night with 40 degree weather. The buffalo chicken pizza was the only thing worth eating.  The vegetarian pizza was limp and watery.  The chicken and waffle pizza was greasy and not flavorful.  Drinks are by the can. I don't think even the 20 year-old me would've liked this place, but it is popular.  If you're desperate for pizza, try Dimo's.  It's relatively inexpensive, and the folks that work there seem friendly.

It's hard to judge this place, considering 99% of the time you come you're completely inebriated coming out of the bars in wrigley. It's pizza, of course it's amazing at 2am!!! The pros: I will say that the wide variety of choices and creative concoctions give them an extra star. From tomato feta, to Bbq chicken, to Mac and frickin' cheese!  The line also moves pretty fast and there's a decent sized sitting area, opposed to many other pizza places. The cons: the dough is thicker than I like, and the pizza itself isn't the best of the best. Like I said above, the topping options are what equals it out.  It also can get pretty wild at night because of all the drunk college kids leaving the bars. I saw a fight break out once, and a girl passed out at her table all in the same night...

I just wanted a big-ass slice of pizza. It was late and the place we'd normally hit was closed. Yelp brought me here.  I was kinda bummed that they didn't have a just-regular-ole-pizza option. Pepperoni, perhaps. They had a vegan option, Mac and cheese, some BBQ chicken number. We went with chicken and waffles. I had apprehensions. The first bite was... sweet. That was strange for a piece of pizza. But by bite 3, I was hooked. Delicious.  I might have to stop back in next week especially if they have chicken and waffles again.

Came in on a rainy day so they had a bucket and a leaky ceiling... didn't stop us from ordering the delicious BBQ chicken and a slice of smore pizza. It was pretty deliciously covered in nutella (or an equivalent?), graham crackers, melted marshmallows... MmmMmm good :)

Dimo's makes vegan pizzas! You can get a cheese-less one, or they use Teese, which I love. I tried the Mac n Cheese pizza and couldn't get enough. I just tried Dimo's for the first time last week, and I've already made plans to go back this weekend. Warning: they may be out of the Vegan Mac n Cheese pizza this Saturday after I'm done. :) I would love another location close to home. Dimo's, please consider a location in Oak Park/Forest Park.

Pretty good pizza by the slice, and I was a fan of the old-fashioned bottles of coke. It was pretty good prices, but my pizza was burnt on the bottom, which made it a little crunchier than I would have liked. Overall good though, and I would go back.

Really flavorful and unique pizzas! We ordered the largest size with half and half The Buff Chick and the Chicky Chicky Parm Parm, then a 12in Al Pastor. All three were super filling but we could not stop at just one slice! The Buff Chick was mainly a BBQ Chicken and had a nice kick to it and the chess sprinkled on top was super delish, the Chicky Parm had different cheeses and a different sauce so it was a nice flavor change from the Buff Chick. The Al Pastor was the winner in my heart, because it was just so savory, smoky, cheesy, and all around delicious. Will for sure be ordering from here again!

Ordered from Grubhub due to 5 star rating with 225 reviews and the only bad reviews were on delivery time. We got the 20 in pepperoni pizza with a side of crushed peppers; it arrived in the time window GrubHub alotted. It was delivered by bike, so it wasn't hot, but the delivery driver was extremely kind so it wasn't seen as too much of a negative..until my friend and I tried it.  While massively joyous on the size and mass of the pizza, we were just as equally massively disappointed with the taste. The flavor was akin to some weird chemical taste (I coined it as Pinesol, my friend said it was topsoil). Thinking it might've been made with a pan still wet with sanitizer (a place with that high of reviews, it had to be a fluke), we called in about the order. The very kind woman on the phone apologized and offered us a refund or a new pizza - we went with new pizza, because mistakes happen even at 5 star places, right? She said our order is going to the front, and it'd be there in 20 minutes. Awesome!..or so we thought. An hour passes, and we call again to ask for a straight out refund. A different person answers the call, says the pizza is arriving in five minutes, and we concede to waiting. It does arrive in the five minutes, with the same delivery guy as before - even in the frigid and snowing cold, he was extremely apologetic and kind (Dwayne 'NotTheRock' Johnson, you da man).  We eat the new pizza..same chemical taste. We call back immediately; the girl who picked up the first time we called answers. We explain how pumped we were to try the five star pizza, but we were just not pleased with how it tastes. She gave us a refund with profuse apologies, no hassle. They also gave us two free brownies in the box with the new pizza - they were bloody *amazing*. I would order just the brownies from this place. The customer service is why I'm giving this place three stars. Maybe going to a different location or eating in will be a different story, but, for the time being, we're going to stick to pizza paths previously travelled.

Ordered it almost two hours ago. Grub hub said by 3 and it actually came at 4:20. When I called at 3:40 they said it hadn't left yet. I heard the cook tell the woman he still had to make the bbq chicken and she got back on the phone and said it would be "leaving soon" and that she was sorry but offered no compensation. Disappointing experience. The pizza is good but this service is poor.

Dimos has made a great first impression with us but unfortunately their quality and taste has depreciated gradually over time like my Apple iBook from 2002. The last two times the bottom of the pizza were burnt...(mmm...tasty charcoal?) and the music they play is so loud and hard to enjoy my burnt pizza as they assault our ears. We come all the way from Michigan so dining in is the only option we have...

I ordered pizza for delivery at 12:30pm and got my cold disgusting wrong order at 3:30pm, they charged me for items I didn't receive and when I called they said they would give me a refund for the missing items and still have not. Didn't do anything to make it right and still charged me my $4 delivery fee and $5 tip I paid online. When I called to check on my order at 2:30 they said I couldn't cancel bc it was already on the way but obviously that was not the case since it is a 10 min drive from my house and it was still an hour before it came. Very disappointing.

Coming from NYC it is hard to find good pizza in Chicago that is not deep dish.  If you are hungry late night this is the place to go.  It is also great anytime of day as you can order by the slice.  They manage to serve huge slices that can stand on their own with a crispy crust.  They have anything from cheese to pulled pork and even vegan options covering every palate.  The staff is ALWAYS fun and helpful and even gave us a whole pie they made an extra of for free.
Sadly, the pizza is consistently bad now, with ingredients that aren't as fresh as they should be.
Still one of my favorite places to eat in Chicago! Their pizza is inventive and delicious! And the staff is always sweet! Dimos rocks!

My guess is this place does the majority of their business after 10pm.  They serve up big, New York style pizza slices designed to soak up any booze in your stomach after an evening at the bars.  Some of the pies in the window did look sad like they'd been sitting there awhile...but I opted for one that looked fresher, and it was delightful after a few moments warming up in the pizza oven.  While you don't usually select a counter-service restaurant for their service, the service here was friendly and playful as well, a nice touch.

Probably the best pizza place I have ever been to. 13 minutes was all I needed.  Next time I go back to Chicago, I will return.  I had the mac and cheese slice as well as...I can't remember, but I am booking tickets out of EWR as we speak to refresh my memory. Check out the menu online and you'll see things like "Pumpkin Pie" slice and "Chicken 'n Waffles" slice. The list goes on. Two slices were $8 and worth it.  The negative reviews seem to be in regards to the service, I guess I lucked out. It wasn't dead at all in here the Saturday night that I went, but not full. They asked me for my order before I even walked in all the way.
One of the best drunk food spots in Chicago! It's my go-to after 2am. I love the variety.

Holy scrumptious delicious amazing perfect pizza! After searching for a late night delivery pizza and dealing with rude people, we found a place! The girl on the phone was extremely friendly and helpful. I asked for extra cheese and sauce and she assured me that it didn't need any and boy was she right! We ordered the meat lovers pizza and it was so delicious. Chicago pizza, is heaven. We are totally ordering from here again tonight!

The management of Dimo's reached out to me about my bad experiences and insured me they made changes and retrained staff. I showed up a few weeks ago and they are correct! The lines moved, pizza was available and staff was not making mistakes like the past. I was so impressed with the service that I returned a few days later and the great service continued. The old Dimo's is back!! Thanks to the management staff for listening to your customers and now I will put you back on my good list. The food is great if you have not been here then you need to try it out.

Don't even bother...if you want the pizza, which is quality, go to the Wicker Park location. This is run by a bunch of seemingly incompetent and careless people who decide that it's a good idea to close the place down for an hour in the middle of the night for supposed "maintenance" while there are still orders being made by the employees, as is visible through the window. Pretty disappointed to say the least as my past experiences as the Dimo's in Wicker Park have been nothing short of great.

Really struggling to understand the four-star Yelp rating.  I ate here yesterday (Halloween 2015), and the pizza was so salty it was nearly inedible.  Among the worst pizza I've ever had.  The door was wide open on a 50 degree rainy day, and it was freezing and damp inside.  The only reason for a second star is the friendly, quick service.
Great pizza! We ordered half cheese half Mac and cheese and it was fantastic! The delivery was sooooo slow though, we waited almost two hours. Pizza was great though!

I've been to their Wrigleyville location a few times. The pizza was good if you want quick service and something to fill your stomach. My last order of pizza left a bad taste in my mouth. I decided to give their online service a shot. After perusing their menu and placing an order. A few emails later (3 emails postponing the delivery time), I received my pizza. Unfortunately it took just over two hours for my mediocre pizza to arrive with no apology.

Very disappointed. It's a Wednesday night, order goes in on Grub Hub at 7:30 pm estimated delivery time 8:40 pm then that changed to 9:10 but pizza shows up at 9:50pm. Why you ask? They "got busy" said the flustered girl when I called asking wtf happened and that they only had 1 delivery biker for the night. I guess the other guy called off. Ok first of all what's wrong with the managers fingers? You only have 2 delivery bikers? Like everyday? You can't pick up your phone and call someone in? Oh, that's right... it got busy.  The pizza is a whole other story. Clearly it'd been sitting there since we actually ordered it then they decided to "reheat" it but they burned it.. I don't mind getting a cold pizza I have an oven but a burnt pizza I can't fix.  So then I call back omg. Now I'm waiting for a fresh pizza while huffing and puffing and it's 10:15 pm now. I'm not saying I would never order from here again because I know I will. I've had good pizza from here which is why my hopes are always so high but it's a hit or miss with this place.

Perfectly A-Ok pizza place, but 3 stars seems too low, 4 seems... well I've never been disappointed. It's good stuff, the specials can be a little weird for my tastes but if you are more adventurous go for it. I thought I would love the Mac N Cheese pizza. I did not, until I loaded it with hot sauce. I guess even being color blind, I just can't see pizza without wanting to see some red. But, I will say it wasn't terrible. It's a fun, inventive spot that sticks around for a reason. Totally fair costs. Great hours for the night owls.
The slices here are riveting! The flavors are exciting and so delicious. Chicken penne pizza is super amazing! Open late, check it out.

Really good pizza but you never know what you're going to get. Dimos doesn't provide any menu or labels to know what pizza it is. You just have to commit but you need to remember what EXACTLY you ordered or else you get yelled at by other customers that you are so stupid to forget what you ordered. Well folks when I just point a finger at stuff that "looks good", i may not know what NAME it is. Can I just request to have proper management in this place!?!?

It was my first visit at Dos and my last. Today is Sunday September 20th, and Brandon, simon and Amanda were working. I went through the line, nobody took my order. When I got to the register I was told I Was not following the process of ordering pizza, and called a "shifty" customer. My friend and I were the ONLY non-white people in the establishment. Not only were we called "shifty" but also given our pizzas last. Needless to say, it is my first AND last visit here. I would recommend this place if you are white and "know the system," otherwise please avoid. The college kids are racist and rude!

Don't bother. The service is terrible, and the pizza is just okay. There are so many other pizza places in Chicago where you will get great service and great pizza. There's even another location of Dimo's with, I can only hope, better service.  I was so excited about this place because it had good reviews and the concept is just so cool. I was very disappointed. My husband and I walked in and were looking at the menu posted on the wall, trying to decide what to get. We had been looking for maybe a minute and a half when we heard someone shouting at us. There were 4 people in line ahead of us, and nobody behind us. I looked over at the guy behind the counter, who was looking at us, with his hands full of pizza slices. I said "what?" And he shouts again, clearly annoyed, "ARE YOU GETTING SLICES??" And I said "oh, yeah but we're not sure what we want to get yet!" Then he rolled his eyes and said very sarcastically and rude "okay!" And turned around. At that point I was soured, but I wanted to try the pizza. My husband got the eljote corn pizza, and the tomato pesto. I don't remember the name of what I got, it might've been the al pastor, but it was like a taco on a pizza. We ordered, the guy said nothing, huffed and puffed and Put our slices in the oven. And when we paid he was just very unfriendly. We walked outside to eat, cuz I just couldn't wait to get out of there. Mine was pretty good, the eljote was okay, and the tomato pesto was eh.  Like I said, don't bother. At least try the other location.

Oh Dimo's, I loved you from the start. Not only are you open late night (and in wicker park too!) but you combine a combo of Mac n cheese and 'za--I could not be more in love. But seriously, their pizza is awesome drunk or not. So many different flavors, but their regulars (like pepperoni) are great too. Go here now, no really, now.

I used to live next to this place and it's fantastic! Open late, fast and unbelievably tasty. Their mac n cheese pizza is to die for. Creamy, rich and really cheesy. If you have a sweet tooth, they have this smores pizza with a semisweet chocolate base, topped with graham cracker bears and gooey marshmallow. Their basic cheese pizza is great, but come here for the unique flavor combos that regularly change. The only reason I knocked off a star is price. $4 a slice is a tad steep

I've been here before and it was great. When I came last week, it was awful. Both times I got the Mac & Cheese pizza. My slice was had macaroni pasta and shredded cheese that only half melted onto the pasta. No melty goodness, no cheesy delight, I ran to the counter in hopes to save my bite. I told the friendly cashier lady how disappointed I was and showed her a picture of other people's pics of M&C pizza on yelp ...done right... so she could let the pizza maker know that he was doing a poor job of making an eeeeeeaasy pizza.

One of my favorite pizza places in Chicago. The toppings are creative and delicious. You can grab a few pieces and go or eat them at the communal picnic tables. The macaroni pizza is amazing, of course, but I also like the ones with who-knows-what on them. They are like explosions of flavor.

I basically eat here every time I'm in Chicago; imaginative, delicious pizzas in unusual-but-amazing flavour combinations, as well as a comfortably relaxed atmosphere and a two-minute walk from Wrigley Field and by hostel...I'll be honest, I may even keep picking the same hostel due to its proximity to Dimo's.  In summary: amazing pizza, great hours. Would recommend. Drink the Leninade!

Just like the Wicker Park one, but a bit smaller. Both are delicious. The variety of pizza is astounding and they have a new kind every single week for you to try. The staff are always incredibly friendly and are quick and experienced at what they do. Once can never go wrong with Dimo's.

I'm done.  I have been ordering from Dimo's for 3 years and have spent hundreds of dollars there (judge me.).  The past few times I have ordered delivery my food has been late, cold or mediocre or some combination of the above.   Tonight was the last straw. I ordered a pizza, and it arrived 15min late and was poorly made. The crusts is supposed to be bubbly and puffy, and was not. It was thick, chewy (in a bad way), and the bottom was tough.  The dough had, clearly, been overworked.   The is the last straw.  Never ordering from here again.

This place was just what we were looking for! We walked right in and had pizza by the slice in minutes. The crust is very tasty. It had a wide range of pizzas to choose from. I had macaroni and cheese pizza and BBQ pizza that was delicious. Can't wait to go back when visiting Chicago again!

Can't say I understand the good reviews this place gets. Maybe I just caught them on a bad day but I have never had a saltier pizza. It was nearly inedible. Big portions and reasonably priced. Still will not order again.

First off Ill say that their pizza has some weird seasoning or something on it that makes it taste like it was dropped on a dirt and dust covered floor then picked up but not brushed off before serving. Definitely do not care for the taste of this pizza.  HOWEVER I do understand that everyone has different tastes so more importantly Ill get to why I give this place only 1 star. The girl working late on Sunday night was extremely rude. A friend and I walked in and were clearly looking at the options, talking to each other about what we were going to get and she yells...not says, but YELLS at us "Cmon ladies what do you want?" ...mind you there was no one else in line behind us yet so it's not like we were holding up traffic. I said we were deciding and asked what one of the pizzas had on it and she shouts the list of all the options so fast we couldnt even understand what they were. My friend ended up not getting anything cuz this girl had such an attitude....I wouldnt have gotten a piece either but I hadnt ate dinner and it was literally the only pizza place that had come up on my search that was open. Listen, I get that it is late and you probably deal with a lot of drunk people at 2am but not every one is drunk that comes in so dont be impatient and rude to customers.

This place is horrible! Great selection of pizza! Yes! If you love burnt pizza !!! Shit is horrible!! I just ate charcoal! No joke!!!! Hate pizza that's burn! Not to mention waiting inline for 15 min! Horrible experience!

I ordered the special for the day and it was a Mexican slice. You can tell from the uploaded picture that it was kind of a lot for a slice of pizza. I love creativity but this pizza was all over the place! I rather eat a Mexican dish for the amount I paid. I think their usual slices would have been the better option. The cashier was very friendly and the seating looked spacious.

The smaller BYOB Wrigleyville Dimo's is amazing. A much better post-Metro alternative than McDonald's or Taco Bell. For some reason, this location has overcooked the crust of three pizzas I've ordered. So they lose a star... but I'll probably be back enough to have them make it up to me with delicious and quirky pizzas.

Good variety of pizzas.however they dont look so fresh nor did they taste fresh.i think the reason was that they were not heated up right.4 stars-well i have to give them they are different from anybody else and unique,however i wont be coming back.

Yesterday was Dimo's birthday aka $1 slices. Not a bad way to end the night! I had the chicken bacon ranch and a jalapeno popper-style slice. Both were pretty great, but probably a lot better when inebriated.

This place gets busy and sometimes you have to wait.  But it's worth it!  They have some unorthodox choices which makes them different than the 1,000s of other pizza places in Lakeview.  I really liked the mac & cheese pizza I ordered.  Good tasting crust, and not soggy like some other nearby places.  I"ll have to come back and try some other pizzas on the menu.  Parking is a pain though, what else is new?
Good when your drunk from the bars. Haven't had it sober. But I bet its still good.

Pizza is so different, creative and tasty. Chicken and waffles, Mac n cheese, and pasta and Italian sausage all on a pizza crust...so good. Everyday its something different. The feel is hippy. The prices are fair and the staff is funny and nice.

A huge variety of pizza choices. The place was packed but they did a very good job turning people quickly.  I had a slice of the burrito pizza and fish taco.  Both were very tasty, and I left stuffed.

nice lil find thanks to yelp. Had the BBQ chicken pizza minus the ranch, and the smores pizza. both were amazing! especially that smores pizza! and they deliver (oooOOo boy dangerous to any one trying to diet). Love this place just sad I found about it towards the end of my time in the city.
Best pizza we've had in Chicago!! Good variety. Great for getting a bite after the ballgame.
Delicious pizza by the slice. So many strange flavors that taste phenomenal. That Mac & Cheese pizza is really delicious and I'm pretty sure it comes vegan as well!

Pizza is very good.  Docking stars due to bad experiences with delivery. Have received delivery twice... one time they were about 30 mins longer than predicted and the pizza was not in top condition.  The second time... much worse. They turn off Grubhub at completely arbitrary times and so I call and order three pizzas. I repeat the order several times so they know it's three pizzas and after waiting much longer than predicted they showed up with two pizzas.  Then they said they would bring me my final pizza but I would have to wait 45 mins and I would have to pay... I said I would just start ordering from somewhere else and they said they would bring me my pizza for free in a half hour.  An hour later they show up with the pizza, which had cheese on maybe half of the pizza...  I would recommend dining in or carrying out.

What an amazing place. The staff was super helpful, even such a late hour. The pizza was incredible. What amazing choices and flavors. I can't imagine a better late night place to grab some much needed food after a long night of partying in Wrigley. These guys know what they are doing. And what cool art on the walls. Man. I know where I am going for every meal when I'm in Wrigley.  You gotta check this place out.

The Mac & Cheese pizza here is awesome. The staff is super friendly & most importantly they have local Craft Beer on tap which always wins my heart! Definitely a good place to check out. [Pizza/Beer/Vegan friendly - 5 STARS!

I love Dimos! Especially there Chicken & Waffles pizza. Tonight was not the night. There weren't enough pizzas made in holding and I he ventilation wasn't working properly. Smelled like burning dough :(
Pizza was great. As a New Yorker, their regular pie looked and tasted very similar; can't always get a good, foldable slice. Not your typical "deep dish" Chicago.
Was here Saturday night around 230am. Good friendly service. Moved the line fast for being so pack. Will definitely be back to try them crazy topping pizzas..

Going to an afternoon game at Wrigley and we didn't want to go to one of the bars that surround the field. (They were crowded and it was only 12, but in hindsight, probably should have joined in for sure.) Anyways, we were craving pizza and wondered down to Dimo's. They have crazy huge slices of pizza and mostly wild flavors. We got chicken penne pizza, buffalo chicken ranch, and chicken and waffle. They were all amazing. They rotate flavors through so find something you think sounds good and get one. One slice alone was probably not quite enough for me, but the two of us split three, which was the perfect amount. If you're in the area, I highly recommend stopping by. On top of being delicious, it's surprisingly cheap. For three slices and a bottle of coke, it was like $13.

I really wanted pizza and a big tasty salad for dinner. Dimo's allegedly had both so I thought this would work out perfect, not so.  I ordered the Philospher (Greek salad) it came with no feta cheese and no Kalamata olives...what is the point?! I was so disappointed.  The pizza was fine. The cheese and pepperoni were pretty good, the Italian sausage was pretty bland.  Delivery was an hour or so, which I expected on a Sunday night. Probably won't order from here again. Mediocre food in Chicago is not worth a second look with all that there is to choose from.

I used to rave about Dimo's to anyone that would listen. We had a list of 5-7 favorites and would grab slices fairly regularly.  My last trip there was incredibly disappointing. It was at 5:45pm on a weekday (no Cubs game). Food: limited choices (7 total, 2 were vegan); asked about some of the aforementioned favorites and was told they don't make them anymore; overcooked slices (particularly the chicken and waffle, which is excellent when prepared correctly and almost inedible when not) Service: I ended up ordering 3 slices, 1 of which needed to be cooked. I was told it would be 10-12 minutes. After 15, I inquired. The pizza was being pulled from the oven, so I thought I was all set, except that my other slices hadn't even been warmed up yet. I was the only one waiting for food. No excuse.  I love this place in theory, but the quality is slipping.
I've literally never been happier with a vegan meal. Was not at all expecting two vegan slice options. Am very full.
Pita bread with ketchup. No, that's not an appetizer, that's what this place slangs under the guise of "pizza". The worst pizza I've ever had. Despicable.

Great cheese and crust and fun pizzas. Chicken Bacon ranch is phenomenal. Probably one of my favorite pizzas in the city.  They lose a few stars though and here's why: - I've suggested pizzas they should make which were tried and tested in my old job and they were kind of jerks about it each time. Quite lame. - The last time I ordered I wasn't impressed for two reasons: the brownie was a joke - basically a one bite dessert and my pizza wasn't cut at all.

Love love love this place. Been here 3 times and each visit has been amazing. The first time I visited, I had the Mac n cheese pizza which was amazing but a bit too rich for me. The next time I had the chicken Alfredo pizza which was to die for. The third and most recent visit, I had the pulled pork with spicy Sriracha sauce. That was ah.may.zing. Dimo's has never let me down sober or drunk. Will be going back every time I go to Wrigleyville. Also the staff is pretty awesome. Expect to wait in line if you're going after last calls at the bars or on a major drinking holiday (i.e. St. Patty's), but the staff is quick and efficient and you won't have to wait for long. Try their specialty flavors you won't regret!

Dimo's topping options are super creative and change all the time! I've had the chicken and waffles, the pasta alfredo, and a few others. A great place to stop by before/after/during drinking nearby. The crowd is pretty young, and as you can see from the photos its all paper plates etc; but the pizza could not be better. Its not as delicate as pizza from apart or elsewhere but its really creative, 5 stars.
Had Mac and cheese pizza and chicken penn pizza my buddy Brandon had a Chicago dog and the Sriracha and tofu   pizza

Well, after reading all of these fabulous reviews I gave Dimo's a shot...it's average at best. Great variety of ingredients to choose from... My simple test was to order the very same pizza that we generally order from any restaurant (sausage, onion garlic, 'shroom), this way we have a definitive baseline  comparison on the taste of the pizza. Dimo's was quite bland...unfortunately.  I really was so hopeful dammit! The crust is a little too thick and doughy.  I had even placed the pizza in my own oven to crisp it up and it's just not what we are striving for... (Note:  We are Chicagoans who recently moved back home from the east coast and I know first hand what a thin crust NY pizza tastes like and this is not it people!) If ANYONE can offer some helpful advice on where I can find a thin crust that's crispy/chewy, sauce is tasty and ingredients are fresh...please help a brother out!
Mac and Cheese pizza and Chicken & Waffles pizza are the best ever. Customer service is great and they never disappoint!
It's one thing to have a quality product, in this case, pizza, but it's another to deliver so quickly. And on a bike?  Some dude named Dan got here 10 min before I expected a car. That's worth a tip.

This place gets 5 stars just from the many different options of pizza it has. It's even better because you can get slices and don't have to commit to a full pizza, but everything I've had was great.  I don't think I've had a "regular" flavor at this place! Wish it had more seating options but that's not a big deal at all and it does get crowded after bar hours so be ready.  Affordable and unique pizzas!

For a girl that can't make up her mind, I have never been  disappointed with Dimos!  I can have a classic slice, or something they created. I normally order 3 different types and I will not complian!!  They know a good pie!

I love Dimo's pizza.  The employees are always energetic and the feel of the restaurant is electric.  The creative types of pizza always get me.  Mac n Cheese is a go to for many but I generally choose the one with slices of potato with ranch and bbq sauce.  They have a great punch card system as well - if you're a frequenter of Wrigleyville, make sure to get the punch card and take advantage of the free piece of pizza!

I fricken love Dimo's. So many delicious options to choose from, and they're open late which is great. The Mac & Cheese is definitely a must have for first-timers, but the BBQ chicken, bacon, cheddar, ranch is probably my favorite overall. It's probably sinfully bad for you but oh well, that's what exercise is for. Be sure to check out their specials menu. There's a monthly special as well as a weekly one. Sometimes they're amazing (and it's sad when the really good ones only last a week), but sometimes they can be...questionable. Though I'm sure there's tons of people who'd enjoy the exotic options.

I don't know why the hell I have been pussyfooting around with these four-star ratings, but that ends today:  Dimo's is the best slice shop in the city.  It's the only one that inspires my wife and me (usually me) to make excuses to do "errands" in the neighborhood, just so that we can eat lunch here.  Occasionally I have taken the 22 bus down there for lunch and then back without bothering to make an excuse.  That's like paying an additional $1.25 premium on each slice...but it's worth it! Because of: 1.  Some of the best pizza around.  Consistently top-notch, every single time.  Outstanding crust, quality toppings, and excellent balance between all four elements. 2.  Variety of toppings.  Yes, I have ridiculed the concept of macaroni and cheese pizza.  But I have also devoured many a Philly steak slice.  The beauty of Dimo's is that you can always rely on the simple slices (e.g. pepperoni & mushroom or mushroom, spinach, & red pepper) but yet be intrigued by the fancy ones.  Sometimes the fancy ones are a home run, sometimes they are not for me, but in any case I appreciate their creativity.  For example, recently I tried a slice with red onions, kale, fennel, parmesan, and lemon vinaigrette...delicious.  But the weekly special--figs, bacon, arugula, honey, and bleu cheese--sounds too sweet to me.  Either way there is always a delightful element of surprise to every visit. Tamale pizza?  Chicago-style hot dog pizza?  Irish breakfast pizza?  Brilliant. 3.  Awesome people.  All the staff are very friendly, always.  Genuine enthusiasm. 4.  The loyalty/rewards card.  This concept goes a long way with me.  Buy ten and get one free!  A superb incentive for return business.  "The Dimo's punch card--don't leave home without it." Oh, and also: 5.  I have never once heard Mumturd & Sons on the Dimo's music system.

I have a hard time giving out 5 stars but this place deserves it. The pizza was incredibly diverse and all 4 slices I tried were wicked tasty. They have everything from vegan to meat lovers, to s'mores pizza. I wish I lived in the area just to be able to frequent this place! It's a must try!
Kind of a dumpy looking place but the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. $4 a slice for some pretty unique pizzas. I thought they were pretty tasty. Give their weekly specials a try.

I liked this place immediately when I walked through the door, with a young cutie addressing me with a smile and with affectionate terms like "honey" and "sweetie." She was such a darling herself that I couldn't help but smile back. The vegee pizza had--if I remember correctly--red bell peppers, spinach, tomatoes and cheese. They had maybe 8 pizzas out that all looked delicious. I know that mine was, & that they would heat in the pizza oven for a few minutes. The thin crust was delightful. In fact, I would have had another piece if I hadn't been in a hurry. Perhaps the comfort foods of mac & cheese or s'mores.  With warmth in both my belly and my heart, I continued on into the darkness of the night.
Best pizza in the whole universe! That's all I have to say about it. Amazing toppings, very creative and delicious.

They told me not to write a review but I must. Hands down one of my favorite spots. The staff is always super friendly and the Mac and cheese pizza is the peanut butter to my jelly. I love you Mac and cheese pizza. Always innovative thinking of things you normally wouldn't try and I've never been let down.

Quite possibly the worst pizza I've ever had in my life... I don't know whether it was the leathery crust, the chemical-tasting sauce, or the sausage "coins" which could never have been cut from an actual piece of sausage that was the worst but their combination was truly spectacular. If you were raised in the suburbs and think that Domino's is a treat then you will love Dimo's PS: I gave half a slice to my dog and she wouldn't eat it.

If I could give zero stars, I would. We ordered a pizza at 7:25 and were told that the estimated time for delivery was over hour and a half. Ridiculously high wait time, but we held out anyway. Called back at 9:03 when the pizza should have been delivered and were told that it would take an additional hour, and when I told the gentleman on the phone that this wait was unacceptable, he said "ok, have a goodnight" and abruptyly hung up. Never ordering from them again. 2 and a half hours for pizza?

Simple, cheap and delicious. I have been ordering from Dimo's for a few months now and it is consistently great! Dimo's offers a variety of odd-ball pizza combinations, but their traditional cheese + topping combinations is why I am writing this review.  For delicious pizza in the Lakeview area, this is the place!
My go-to pizza place. Convenient online ordering, professional delivery guys, incredible pizza. Stop looking, you've found what's for dinner.

Had to come try the Mac and cheese pizza, and it was worth it. So much better than I expected. The other slices were also really good (really liked the cheesy garlic bread slice), and the service was really friendly and helpful for our first time here.
Delicious pizza, lots of variety, and gets pretty close to authentic New York style. Haven't dined in there yet, but we regularly get delivery.

I'm not sure about amazing, addicted, and I don't typically go for vegan...I just like pizza. This place is ok, the photos represent an accurate display of what you get. The sausage pizza was mediocre at best, the CPA was a bit better....very different. If your looking for a crispy, thin crust pizza, keep looking. If you want interesting topping options on a softer crust, them give them a try. For the calories and the cash, I will choose somewhere else next time.

Never have I been to a pizza place where they include the ranch on the pizza for you! With pizza by the slice and open late it's hard for anyone to say no to this kind of deal. Try the bacon, chicken, BBQ and ranch! Incredible
